carousel_items: Take Cellcept on an empty stomach, at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after a meal.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Cellcept can hurt or kill a fetus during pregnancy. Females of childbearing age must use two forms of birth control 4 weeks before, during, and 6 weeks after treatment.
Can cause stomach upset, headache, trouble sleeping, or affect your blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol control.
Let your doctor know about any unusual bleeding, low energy, weakness, or flu-like symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Cellcept is an immunosuppresant that lowers the activity of your immune system, so it doesn't attack the transplanted organ.
basics.bottom_line: Cellcept is a good medication that prevents rejection of an organ transplant, but it can cause annoying stomach problems like diarrhea.
downsides: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Cellcept isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
Diarrhea is the main reason why people stop taking Cellcept.
If you're interested in becoming pregnant, you need to switch to a different medication since Cellcept can cause serious birth defects.
You may need to take another medicine to control your blood pressure, blood sugar, or cholesterol while on this.
Since it's an immunosuppressant, it can increase your risk of infections and certain cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Cellcept isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
Diarrhea is the main reason why people stop taking Cellcept.
If you're interested in becoming pregnant, you need to switch to a different medication since Cellcept can cause serious birth defects.
You may need to take another medicine to control your blood pressure, blood sugar, or cholesterol while on this.
Since it's an immunosuppressant, it can increase your risk of infections and certain cancers.

upsides: It's a first-choice medication for preventing organ rejection since it doesn't hurt the kidneys or liver like other medications in its class.
Can often be used by itself to prevent rejection without using more complicated medications like steroids or Tacrolimus.
However, survival rates are the highest and rejection is the lowest when Cellcept is used with other medications to prevent transplant rejection.

upsides_processed.orig: It's a first-choice medication for preventing organ rejection since it doesn't hurt the kidneys or liver like other medications in its class.
Can often be used by itself to prevent rejection without using more complicated medications like steroids or Tacrolimus.
However, survival rates are the highest and rejection is the lowest when Cellcept is used with other medications to prevent transplant rejection.

drugs.name: Cellcept

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Cellcept on an empty stomach, at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after a meal.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Cellcept can hurt or kill a fetus during pregnancy. Females of childbearing age must use two forms of birth control 4 weeks before, during, and 6 weeks after treatment.
Can cause stomach upset, headache, trouble sleeping, or affect your blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol control.
Let your doctor know about any unusual bleeding, low energy, weakness, or flu-like symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can cause serious birth defects in a fetus. Don't use Cellcept while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can cause serious birth defects in a fetus. Don't use Cellcept while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can lower white blood cell counts, the cells that help your body fight infections. It can also cause pure red cell aplasia (PRCA), a type of anemia. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can lower white blood cell counts, the cells that help your body fight infections. It can also cause pure red cell aplasia (PRCA), a type of anemia. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Cellcept has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Cellcept has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

carousel_items: Immediate-release capsules can be taken with or without food, just be consistent in how you take it. Extended-release capsules should be taken on an empty stomach, 1 hour before or 2 hours after food.
When getting a transplant, you'll be given several medications. To reduce side effects and interactions, be sure to tell your doctor about any other medications or vitamins you're taking.

Tacrolimus and other immunosuppressants can lower your body's ability to fight infection. It's important that you practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with people who are sick, wear gloves when you garden, keep any cuts clean and covered, and avoid sharing towels or sponges.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Let your doctor know about any flu-like symptoms, muscle weakness or cramps, irregular heart beat, changes in eyesight, or if you're not urinating like you normally do.

basics.benefits_moa: Tacrolimus is an immunosuppresant that lowers the activity of your immune system, so it doesn't attack the transplanted organ.
basics.bottom_line: Tacrolimus is a good medication that prevents rejection of an organ transplant, but there are a lot of rules to follow while taking it.
downsides: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Tacrolimus isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
20% of patients need insulin to control their blood sugar while taking Tacrolimus.
Comes with potentially serious side effects like kidney damage, seizures, tremor, and hallucinations.
You'll likely need to take corticosteroids with Tacrolimus.
Similar immunosuppressant medications can have fewer side effects.
Tacrolimus, like all immunosuppressants increases your risk of infection and certain cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Tacrolimus isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
20% of patients need insulin to control their blood sugar while taking Tacrolimus.
Comes with potentially serious side effects like kidney damage, seizures, tremor, and hallucinations.
You'll likely need to take corticosteroids with Tacrolimus.
Similar immunosuppressant medications can have fewer side effects.
Tacrolimus, like all immunosuppressants increases your risk of infection and certain cancers.

upsides: 96% of patients using Tacrolimus maintained healthy organ transplants.
Can be taken by mouth within 24 hours of a transplant, helping reduce the complications of a lengthy hospital stay.
Patients taking Tacrolimus had fewer heart problems than those taking similar medications.
Comes as an extended-release capsule, so it can be taken just once a day.
Tacrolimus doesn't cause hirsutism (unexpected hair growth) or gum overgrowth like Cyclosporine.

upsides_processed.orig: 96% of patients using Tacrolimus maintained healthy organ transplants.
Can be taken by mouth within 24 hours of a transplant, helping reduce the complications of a lengthy hospital stay.
Patients taking Tacrolimus had fewer heart problems than those taking similar medications.
Comes as an extended-release capsule, so it can be taken just once a day.
Tacrolimus doesn't cause hirsutism (unexpected hair growth) or gum overgrowth like Cyclosporine.

userStories.tip: Prograf does cause tremors in my hands - nothing noticeable - but enough that I can no longer do my own nails. The benefits far exceed that one drawback for me.
Replacing ciclosporin with this stopped my gum growth, Be very strict re timing - 12 hour intervals, capsules are small, check baseline glucose levels.

drugs.name: Prograf

carousel_items_processed.orig: Immediate-release capsules can be taken with or without food, just be consistent in how you take it. Extended-release capsules should be taken on an empty stomach, 1 hour before or 2 hours after food.
When getting a transplant, you'll be given several medications. To reduce side effects and interactions, be sure to tell your doctor about any other medications or vitamins you're taking.

Tacrolimus and other immunosuppressants can lower your body's ability to fight infection. It's important that you practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with people who are sick, wear gloves when you garden, keep any cuts clean and covered, and avoid sharing towels or sponges.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Let your doctor know about any flu-like symptoms, muscle weakness or cramps, irregular heart beat, changes in eyesight, or if you're not urinating like you normally do.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Tacrolimus has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Tacrolimus has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can cause an irregular heartbeat. It can also increase your risk risk of thickened heart muscles (preventing your heart from working properly). Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Tacrolimus.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can cause an irregular heartbeat. It can also increase your risk risk of thickened heart muscles (preventing your heart from working properly). Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Tacrolimus.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach or intestine damage
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

risks_warnings.title: Diabetes
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of diabetes. If you are at risk, you'll need to monitor your blood glucose levels often. There's a higher risk for African-American and Hispanic kidney transplant patients.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of diabetes. If you are at risk, you'll need to monitor your blood glucose levels often. There's a higher risk for African-American and Hispanic kidney transplant patients.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Kidney damage can occur when Tacrolimus is used in high doses, especially in patients with impaired kidney function, or with other damaging (nephrotoxic) drugs like Sirolimus, Cyclosporine.

description_processed.orig: Kidney damage can occur when Tacrolimus is used in high doses, especially in patients with impaired kidney function, or with other damaging (nephrotoxic) drugs like Sirolimus, Cyclosporine.

carousel_items: If you're sexually active, you and your partner should use birth control, since Azathioprine can cause birth defects.
If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, your joint damage cant be reversed, so keep up with your physical therapy and get plenty of rest.
While taking Azathioprine, your body is susceptible to infection; so be sure to wash your hands often and keep distance from with people who are sick.
It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

basics.benefits_moa: Azathioprine is an immunosuppressant medication. It blocks the production of the white blood cells that kill unfamiliar cells.
basics.bottom_line: Azathioprine is an effective medication for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and transplant rejection, but comes with a heavy list of side effects.
downsides: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

downsides_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for rheumatoid arthritis, you'll likely need to take additional medications to control your symptoms.
While taking Azathioprine, you will have to get your blood tested once a week for the first month, every other week for the second and third month, and once every month after that.
Along with other side effects, your hair may begin to change color or fall out when you first start taking Azathioprine, but this is usually temporary.
You'll likely have to take additional medications, like methotrexate to keep your rheumatoid arthritis in remission.

upsides: Azathioprine has proven to be effective in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
Azathioprine decreases the pain, stiffness, and swelling that most people have with rheumatoid arthritis.
You can still get vaccinated for the flu while taking Azathioprine.
Drinking alcohol is okay while taking Azathioprine.

upsides_processed.orig: Azathioprine has proven to be effective in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
Azathioprine decreases the pain, stiffness, and swelling that most people have with rheumatoid arthritis.
You can still get vaccinated for the flu while taking Azathioprine.
Drinking alcohol is okay while taking Azathioprine.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents organ rejection and relieves joint pain and inflammation.

userStories.tip: It attacked my liver and kidneys.  I developed drug induced diabetes.  Everything cleared up when I was switched to cellcept.

userStories.identifier: busy Engineer with severe Crohn's Diseas
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: One of the side effect was muscular and skeletal pain. After 2-3 weeks on the medication I was unable to walk without the aid of two walking sticks. Symptoms last for many months after stopping the medication.

drugs.name: Imuran

It is typical to have some nausea when you first start taking Azathioprine; if it's unbearable, let your doctor know.
Don't sun tan while taking this medication. Always use sunscreen and wear a long-sleeved shirt, pants, hat, and sunglasses.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Azathioprine has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

risks_warnings.title: Decreased blood cells
risks_warnings.description: Though your doctor will order tests to make sure the level of Azathioprine in your blood is safe, can cause a decrease in the amount of blood cells your body has. This may also lead to a suppression and toxicity of your bone marrow. People with low to no thiopurine S-methyltransferase (TMPT) activity have a higher chance of this.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infection
risks_warnings.description: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

description_processed.orig: If you take Azathioprine for a long time it can increase your risk of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight, and be more serious.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Azathioprine has been known to cause a decrease in the amount, and quality of sperm temporarily. It has also been known to cause harm to the fetus. For these reasons, it is important to use medically acceptable forms of contraception while receiving Azathioprine. In certain conditions however, the benefits of taking Azathioprine outweigh the risks, and pregnant women should continue taking it.
